title: Dietary changes when you are sleep deprived
content: Inferior fuel partitioning, hyperinsulinemia, impaired glucose disposal, and a tendency to probably eat more junk food are some of the dietary changes that occur when you are sleep deprived. Fuel partitioning is affected by sleep, and respiratory quotient goes up when sleep deprived, which signals a metabolic inefficiency. Peter Attia says that he finds it hard to avoid junk food when he is sleep deprived, and that sleep is probably the single greatest tool in his arsenal to eat well.

title: Dieting while sleep deprived
content: Dieting when underslept (6 hrs or less) is much less effective in terms of fat loss. If underslept, 70% of what you lose is from lean muscle mass (the body holds onto fat). A big reason for this is the high levels of cortisol (stress hormone) and insulin.
